page.title: 02Enviroment in Penryn
page.content: {Penryn}is one of{Cornwalls}oldest towns.The{Domesday Survey}of{1086} recorded it as a place of importance, dating back to Saxon times. Lying in twin valleys at the head of the{Penryn River,}an off shoot,of{Carrick Roads,Penryn}retains an old-world atmosphere.The town covers little more than a square mile or so,with just over{five thousand {inhabitants. The town centre extends from the river with its{Quays }and { {Wharves,}along {Commercial Road,}via the modern throughfare of{Quay Hill}to the old throughfare of{Broad Street} and{Fish cross,}which links with the {Higher}and{Lower Market Street. { { {
